<div class="esv"><h2>Galatians 1</h2>
<div class="esv-text"><h3 id="p48001001.01-1">Greeting</h3>
<p class="chapter-first" id="p48001001.02-1"><span class="chapter-num" id="v48001001-1">1:1&nbsp;</span>Paul, an apostle&#8212;not from men nor through man, but through Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised him from the dead&#8212; <span class="verse-num" id="v48001002-1">2&nbsp;</span>and all the brothers<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f1" id="b1" title="Or 'brothers and sisters'. The plural Greek word 'adelphoi' (translated &quot;brothers&quot;) refers to siblings in a family. In New Testament usage, depending on the context, 'adelphoi' may refer either to men or to both men and women who are siblings (brothers and sisters) in God's family, the church; also verse 11">[1]</a></span> who are with me,</p>
<p id="p48001002.09-1">To the churches of Galatia:</p>
 <p id="p48001003.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v48001003-1">3&nbsp;</span>Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, <span class="verse-num" id="v48001004-1">4&nbsp;</span>who gave himself for our sins to deliver us from the present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father, <span class="verse-num" id="v48001005-1">5&nbsp;</span>to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen.</p>
 <h3 id="p48001006.01-1">No Other Gospel</h3>
<p id="p48001006.04-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v48001006-1">6&nbsp;</span>I am astonished that you are so quickly deserting him who called you in the grace of Christ and are turning to a different gospel&#8212; <span class="verse-num" id="v48001007-1">7&nbsp;</span>not that there is another one, but there are some who trouble you and want to distort the gospel of Christ. <span class="verse-num" id="v48001008-1">8&nbsp;</span>But even if we or an angel from heaven should preach to you a gospel contrary to the one we preached to you, let him be accursed. <span class="verse-num" id="v48001009-1">9&nbsp;</span>As we have said before, so now I say again: If anyone is preaching to you a gospel contrary to the one you received, let him be accursed.</p>
 <p id="p48001010.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v48001010-1">10&nbsp;</span>For am I now seeking the approval of man, or of God? Or am I trying to please man? If I were still trying to please man, I would not be a servant<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f2" id="b2" title="Or 'slave'; Greek 'bondservant'">[2]</a></span> of Christ.</p>
 <h3 id="p48001011.01-1">Paul Called by God</h3>
<p id="p48001011.05-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v48001011-1">11&nbsp;</span>For I would have you know, brothers, that the gospel that was preached by me is not man's gospel.<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f3" id="b3" title="Greek 'not according to man'">[3]</a></span> <span class="verse-num" id="v48001012-1">12&nbsp;</span>For I did not receive it from any man, nor was I taught it, but I received it through a revelation of Jesus Christ. <span class="verse-num" id="v48001013-1">13&nbsp;</span>For you have heard of my former life in Judaism, how I persecuted the church of God violently and tried to destroy it. <span class="verse-num" id="v48001014-1">14&nbsp;</span>And I was advancing in Judaism beyond many of my own age among my people, so extremely zealous was I for the traditions of my fathers. <span class="verse-num" id="v48001015-1">15&nbsp;</span>But when he who had set me apart before I was born,<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f4" id="b4" title="Greek 'set me apart from my mother's womb'">[4]</a></span> and who called me by his grace, <span class="verse-num" id="v48001016-1">16&nbsp;</span>was pleased to reveal his Son to<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f5" id="b5" title="Greek 'in'">[5]</a></span> me, in order that I might preach him among the Gentiles, I did not immediately consult with anyone;<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f6" id="b6" title="Greek 'with flesh and blood'">[6]</a></span> <span class="verse-num" id="v48001017-1">17&nbsp;</span>nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me, but I went away into Arabia, and returned again to Damascus.</p>
 <p id="p48001018.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v48001018-1">18&nbsp;</span>Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to visit Cephas and remained with him fifteen days. <span class="verse-num" id="v48001019-1">19&nbsp;</span>But I saw none of the other apostles except James the Lord's brother. <span class="verse-num" id="v48001020-1">20&nbsp;</span>(In what I am writing to you, before God, I do not lie!) <span class="verse-num" id="v48001021-1">21&nbsp;</span>Then I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia. <span class="verse-num" id="v48001022-1">22&nbsp;</span>And I was still unknown in person to the churches of Judea that are in Christ. <span class="verse-num" id="v48001023-1">23&nbsp;</span>They only were hearing it said, &#8220;He who used to persecute us is now preaching the faith he once tried to destroy.&#8221; <span class="verse-num" id="v48001024-1">24&nbsp;</span>And they glorified God because of me.</p>
</div>
